title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 122.4 - Police officer procedures
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 122.4 - Police officer procedures

State Regulations
(a) Issuance of summons and complaint. When a
summons and complaint is issued for a traffic infraction, the police officer
shall complete the appropriate portions of Part I and deliver the summons to
the alleged violator. Any variation from this procedure shall not affect the
validity of any summons or complaint unless such variation results in a denial
of due process. (b) If a ticket or
any part of it is mutilated or voided, the police officer to whom it was
assigned shall return all parts of the ticket to his command. (c) Lost ticket. If a ticket or any part of
it is lost, the police officer to whom it was assigned shall file with his
command a report as to the loss of the ticket, together with any parts of the
ticket which have not been lost. (d) Safeguarding of tickets. Each agency to
which tickets are issued shall maintain secure facilities for the storage of
all tickets held by them. (e) Reports. Each agency using such tickets shall make a report to the commissioner
of all tickets secured by such agency and all summonses and complaints, appearance tickets and notices of violation issued. Such report shall be made
as required by the commissioner. (f) Delivery of Part I. The agency shall
segregate Part I of all tickets issued, by court or bureau before which it is
returnable, and shall deliver the same to the appropriate court or bureau. The
method of delivery to the bureau will be in accordance with instructions given
by the commissioner to each agency. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
122.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
